boat.full_description:
'Peerie Maa' had a sliding gunter with boom using a spinnaker boom heel fitting in a brass track for the gaff. Sails dated by Jeckells to be pre-1956. The repairs extant in the hull indicate that she may have been built as a utility boat before being fitted out with a cut down Shetland model racing rig.

She's had a new suit of terylene sails, with new luff groove gaff with ash jaws made, various repairs and refits returning original Shetland practice. Also uses shorter mast and standing lug, boomless main.
boat.name: Peerie Maa
boat.short_description: 'Peerie Maa', built in C1930 is a Shetland utility boat, with original rig cotton sails by Jeckells of Lowestoft.
